briefTitle: Comparative Efficacy & Safety Study of D961H Versus Placebo for the Prevention of Gastric and Duodenal Ulcers With Low-dose Aspirin
officialTitle: A Phase III Multinational, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel-group, Comparative Efficacy and Safety Study of D961H (20 mg Once Daily) Versus Placebo for Prevention of Gastric and/or Duodenal Ulcers Associated With Continuous Low-dose Aspirin (LDA) Use
summary: To assess the efficacy of D961H 20 mg once daily (q.d.) versus placebo in continuous treatment involving patients with a history of gastric and/or duodenal ulcers receiving daily Low-dose aspirin therapy by evaluating time from randomisation to occurrence of gastric and/or duodenal ulcers.

primaryOutcome.measure: Time From Randomization to Occurrence of Gastric and/or Duodenal Ulcers up to Data Cut-off Date for Interim Analysis.
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: From randomisation to up to 48 weeks (Maximum follow-up period at the interim analysis)
